resources.string: or connect to an existing one
Demo session has been created. Your session code is:
You will need this code to connect to other devices.

Mobeelizer is a Synchronisation-as-a-Service for mobile developers. We strive to make it ridiculously easy to get synchronisation for mobile apps up and running, so you can focus on creating mobile apps, without worrying about data exchange.

 When using Mobeelizer, we automatically take care about the backend, configuration and complicated aspect of synchronisation conflicts.

 Visit mobeelizer.com for more info.

 This app contains examples of using mobeelizer in different scenarios. You can see how to sync data, binary files or how to handle conflicts. It's only a small possibilities what mobeelizer can do for you. So have fun!

So you've seen how revolutionary mobeelizer is and what Synchronization-as-a-Service means for your app.

 Now it's time for you to code&play with mobeelizer by yourself.

 Visit mobeelizer.com for more info.
Warning: Items marked with | were not synchronized, because other user edited them at the same time.

This example shows a simple way to share data between multiple users and devices. Add movies to the list and sync them with the cloud. The other users will be able to see them on their devices.\n\nUse “add” button to add new title to the list and “sync” button to synchronize data with the cloud.

This example shows how to share binary data between multiple users and devices. Take photos and sync them with the others.\n\nUse “add photo” button to take new photo and “sync” button to synchronize it with the cloud.

This example shows how to protect your shared data. Add movies to the list and sync them with the cloud. The movie’s director is a protected field, only You can see it.\n\nUse “add” button to add new title to the list and “sync” button to synchronize data with the cloud.

This example shows conflicts arise when two users modify the same data. Add movies to the list and sync them with the cloud. Next change the score of this movie on multiple devices. Try to sync.\n\nUse “add” button to add new title to the list and “sync” button to synchronize data with the cloud. The score of the movie can be changed by clicking on the “score” icon.

This example shows conflicts arise when two users modify related data. Add order and movies to the list and sync them with the cloud. Next on one device change order’s status and on the other change, add or remove, movies from this order. Try to sync.\n\nUse “add” button to add new order to the list and “sync” button to synchronize data with the cloud. The status of the order can be changed by clicking on the “status” icon. Use “plus” to add movies to order and long-press to remove them.
